We found one fellow working who was willing to practice his english on us which was helpful.  The food was fresh and they had reasonable pricing.The good:Lemon PieGoxuaDates with BaconGoat cheese w port wine, onion, honey and nutsBrie cheese au gratin, tomato jam and oliveThe tempranillo by the glassThe free pacharan shotsThe meh:Codfish stuffed red pepper - undisclosed breading and flavorless56 Euros for 18 tapas, 3 drinks, 2 desserts, and 2 coffeesThe bad:The bar seats are horrendousThe olive, pepper, and anchovy tapas that my coworker ordered without anchovy came with anchovy stuffed peppers.  He said he had an allergy and they did not replace with unstuffed olivesThe friendly english speaking mexican looking guy who originally took our order for 5 different hot tapas was reprimanded by his coworkers and then told us we could not order 1 of anything and that we should select from the hot tapas plates offered.  We thought we were back at square 1 then our order came out with the 5 different tapas.  Mixed messages...
